messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Magazines
messages.msgSnippet: We  love Nintento Power and Mad! My son also loves puzzles and animal magazines Oh and National Geographic kids! I am thinking about getting him ESPN kids
messages.messageBody:
We  love Nintento Power and Mad!
My son also loves puzzles and animal magazines
Oh and National Geographic kids!
I am thinking about getting him ESPN kids too.
 
Alex Polikowsky

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Magazines
messages.msgSnippet: Ive been looking at that very same question.  I am considering Nintendo Power, National Geographic, and Mad at this point.. He likes that Mad t.v show but I
messages.messageBody:
Ive been looking at that very same question. I am considering Nintendo Power, National Geographic, and Mad at this point.. He likes that Mad t.v show but I dont know if the magazine is similiar or for targeted toward a little bit older individuals. I was also thinking about getting a subscription to a comic book or two. DC comics have them.
My son is 9.

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Tina Tarbutton <tina.tarbutton@...> wrote:
>
> I'm considering ordering a few magazine subscriptions for my 10 y/o.
> What are the favorites in your family? He specifically loves gaming,
> war history, guns/weapons, science related stuff and comic style
> books.
>
> Thanks for any advice!
>
> Tina
>

messages.subject: Magazines
messages.msgSnippet: I m considering ordering a few magazine subscriptions for my 10 y/o. What are the favorites in your family?  He specifically loves gaming, war history,
messages.messageBody:
I'm considering ordering a few magazine subscriptions for my 10 y/o.
What are the favorites in your family? He specifically loves gaming,
war history, guns/weapons, science related stuff and comic style
books.

Thanks for any advice!

Tina
